pirates.name: Bartholomew Roberts
pirates.shortBio: He was the last great pirate of the golden age who plundered more than 400 ships. His boldness and abilities made him one of the most successful pirates.

pirates.name: Edward Teach
pirates.shortBio: These are facts about the notorious captain and certainly most famous pirate of all time. His deeds, behavior and a terrifying image made him a perfect villain, who harassed many ships in Caribbean.

pirates.name: John Rackham
pirates.shortBio: A typical small-time pirate, whose fame comes from the fact that two of the most famous woman pirates, Anne Bonny and Mary Read sailed under his flag.

pirates.name: Charles Vane
pirates.shortBio: A very skillful pirate who was brave enough to stand against the mighty governor, Woodes Rogers. However, a couple of unfortunate events ended his career sooner than he expected.

pirates.name: Edward England
pirates.shortBio: This Irishman was a successful pirate, who captured many ships. However, his kindness and not-so-pirate attitude prevented him to become even greater.

pirates.name: Edward Low
pirates.shortBio: Many stories from the famous Golden Age of Piracy tell the tales of notorious pirate captains, but none can claim that Edward Low was not one of the vilest and cruelest pirate captains of that time. Here you can find out more about his life, from the early age of crime to the heights and lows of his pirate career.

pirates.name: Henry Every
pirates.shortBio: Every was one of the rare pirates who chose to retire from piracy and lived rest of his life as a rich man.

pirates.name: Howell Davis
pirates.shortBio: The intelligent pirate, who often used trickery instead of relying only on arms and firepower.

pirates.name: Mary Read
pirates.shortBio: This unfortunate girl spent most of her life pretending to be a man. She was treated as woman only on one occasion.

pirates.name: Samuel Bellamy
pirates.shortBio: Known facts about Samuel Bellamy’s pirate career and his famous love story, which inspired many writers.

pirates.name: Stede Bonnet
pirates.shortBio: Stede Bonnet was a former major and wealthy man who suddenly turned to piracy. He became famous despite the fact that he was inexperienced and incompetent pirate.

pirates.name: William Kidd
pirates.shortBio: Captain Kidd was a successful privateer who became pirate thanks to a couple of unfortunate events. The stories about his buried treasure made him even more popular.

pirates.name: Emanuel Wynn
pirates.shortBio: Emanuel Wynn was a French pirate active in the beginning 18th century. Today he is probably most knows as the first pirate to fly the Jolly Roger.

pirates.name: Christopher Moody
pirates.shortBio: Biography of Christopher Moody, famous pirate who was known for his leave no prisoners alive policy and unique Jolly Roger Flag with red and gold colors, instead of traditional black and white.
